div1.p: Boyer provides news of recent battles in Virginia.

I take the pleasure to drop a few lines to let you know that I am well yet hopeing that you are the same further I let you kno that we left our Camp at Perry mountain on the 2 of may and the next day we crossed the rapidan river and that day the Battle commenced and was kept up until the 13th when we left the front with about eight thousand Priseners and took them Back to this place This is the greatest lot of rebs I ever saw There was eigh
days hard fighting while I was in the frond but I had good luck this time I was not in the fight this time I am in the dismounted Battalion we have no horses and were kept as rear gard this was the hardest fighting I ever heard and the lose is great on both sides but I heard that there lose is greater than ours we are now encamped near Bell Plain landing were our boats are landing with our provishions further I let you know that Jarrmiah Drudenbroth is wounded
in the leg he is now in the hospitel I also let you know that I saw Brother John they day before we left camp at perry Mountain I dident hear eny thing of him since I must soon close for this time write soon I don't know how long we will stay here but I think not very long the weather is warm and we have rain almost evry day I will also send you five dollars of Confederate money that I got from rebel prisener excuse
my bad writing

write soon again to my father
Peter Boyer
